html:
Not contént, but in cóntent

Most challenging (and disappointing) things about working in Content Design.

Dagoth Ur is one creepy guy. He’s also the final boss of a videogame TES: Morrowind. When you finally come to kill him (he lives inside a massive volcano), he says this to the player:

What a fool you are. I’m a god. How can you kill a god? What a grand and intoxicating innocence.

Thinking content design is just nice words, smooth syntax, and daisies? That’s a grand and intoxicating innocence. Content Design (CD) is the underestimated boss of UX — make no mistake.

Trigger warning — I use Content Designer and UX Writer interchangeably:

Understanding the most disappointing things about CD can help you set realistic expectations. It can also help spare you from becoming an unbearable snob, especially if you’re just starting (“what-a-grand-and-intoxicating-innocence”) your career path.

The first concept you learn is useless

Content Design (UX Writing) is about helping create user-centered (or human-centered, as DN calls it)…
